content: 9 sts join with invj 38 30 decrease round 3 chain 1 working in blo single_crochet or hbdc in each of the first 11 9 sts decrease next 2 sts together single_crochet or hbdc in each of the next 12 8 sts decrease next 2 sts together single_crochet or hbdc in each of the last 11 9 sts join with invj 36 28 decrease round 4 chain 1 working in blo single_crochet or hbdc in each of the first 11 8 sts decrease next 2 sts together single_crochet or hbdc in each of the next 10 8 sts decrease next 2 sts together single_crochet or hbdc in each of the last 11 8 sts join with invj 34 26 if using yarn weight 5 continue to decrease round 5 if using yarn weight 6 the hat should be at 8 - 8 5 inches if desired add more row for height here otherwise proceed to finishing off and cinching the top decrease round 5 this round is only if you are using yarn weight 5 chain 1 working in blo single_crochet or hbdc in each of the first 10 sts decrease next 2 sts together single_crochet or hbdc in each of the next 10 sts decrease next 2 sts together single_crochet or hbdc in each of the last 10 sts join with invj 32 at this point if you followed the pattern exactly for yarn weight 5 without adding or subtracting row your hat should be 8 tall if desired add more row for height here leave a long tail for cinching and cut remaining yarn the easy escapade beanie by amy drossner copyright © november 2021 6 with a yarn needle weave the tail in and out of every other stitch of the last row pull tight and make a couple of stitches across the tightened round to secure the cinch in place optional push the needle through the middle of the top to the inside of the hat working now on the inside of the hat use the yarn needle to sew a button onto the top of the inside this will allow for a pom to be attached but still be removable finish off attach your pom if desired and you re finished with your easy escapade beanie 🙂 than� yo� s� muc� fo� you� interes� i� m� pa�er� b� sur� t� shar� phot�� an� ❤ feedbac� of you� eas� escapad� beani� wit� m� terms and conditions this pattern is intended to be used and enjoyed by individuals and for small scale/personal sales this pattern may not be used sold or distributed commercially on a large scale you have my permission to sell any easy escapade beanies made from this pattern at your local craft fairs markets etc please credit amy drossner and link to my pattern page where available on ravelry etsy etc when selling the finished beanie online this pattern and all images are copyrighted please feel free to share the link to this pattern
